mediaPlan.tactic: Connected TV — Streaming (Hulu, Peacock, YouTube TV)

brief.executiveSummary: Locke AI Co. is launching the Locke AirPod AI — a wearable AI companion in an AirPod form factor — at OpenAI Device Day on April 1, 2026. This campaign drives pre-launch awareness and day-one pre-orders through a coordinated multi-channel digital media blitz across CTV, Display, Video, Audio, and Social.
brief.whyNow: OpenAI Device Day creates a massive cultural moment for AI hardware. Launching alongside the event captures earned media amplification, positions Locke as a first-mover in wearable AI, and rides the news cycle for maximum reach.
brief.primaryOutcome: 10,000 pre-orders within first 30 days of campaign launch
messagePillars: AI that goes where you go — no screen required
Privacy-first: on-device processing, your data stays yours
Seamless integration with the tools you already use
Designed for real life — meetings, commutes, workouts, everything
brief.valueProposition: The first truly personal AI assistant that lives in your ear — always listening when you want, completely private when you don't.
brief.reasonToBelieve: On-device neural engine, 18-hour battery, works with 200+ apps, military-grade encryption, designed by ex-Apple audio engineers

audience.primary: Tech-forward professionals 25-45, HHI $100K+, early adopters of AI tools (ChatGPT, Copilot, etc.)
audience.secondary: Productivity enthusiasts, podcast listeners, remote workers
audience.targeting: 1P email lists, AI tool user lookalikes, tech publication readers, CTV cord-cutters

compliance.privacyStance: On-device processing emphasized. No cloud storage of conversations unless user opts in.
compliance.disclosures: "AI-generated responses may not always be accurate. See lockeai.co/safety for details."
compliance.wordsToAvoid: "Always right", "replaces your phone", "listens to everything", health/medical claims
